Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a variety of land habitats (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and water habitats (e.g., pond, stream).
The student can include and label different plants found in each habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants).
The student can include and label different animals found in each habitat (e.g., lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, clams).
The student can make comparisons by drawing similar and different living things in various habitats.
The student can identify and draw patterns in the natural world, showing how different habitats support different kinds of living things.
